results.title: The Incredibles
results.creator_credit: Pixar Animation Studios, Walt Disney Pictures, John Walker and Brad Bird
results.brief_description: Fun, fun, fun. That is the verdict on the latest ingenious animated feature from Pixar. Based around a family of ‘supers’ (aka superheroes) “The Incredibles” introduces Robert “Mr Incredible”, consigned to a life of mind-numbing boredom in suburbia who longs for his glory days as a world saving super hero. Spiritually crushed by a pen-pushing insurance claim job, Robert toils under the daily grind in the suburbs with loyal wife Helen (“Elastigirl”) and their three children. Bob’s zest for life is revived when he is called upon by the mysterious Mirage to perform some planet-saving assignments, but he is unwittingly drawn into confrontation with an old foe who seeks to bring all the Supers down. Bob must rely on his family to help when the situation becomes desperate and the audience gets to discover how super, these Supers really are. Features the voices of Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter, and Samuel L. Jackson.

results.title: The Incredible shrinking man
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, Albert Zugsmith and Jack Arnold
results.brief_description: This low-budget feature is a powerful and perverse example of American Cold War cinema. While holidaying with his wife, Scott Carey sails into a radio-active storm. He slowly becomes aware that his body is changing and he descends into despair as he continues to shrink until he is only a few inches tall. His familiar suburban world begins to transform into a nightmare jungle. The staircase becomes an impenetrable cliff wall and the family cat, a terrifying monster. Suprisingly the special effects stand the test of time. It is easy to laugh at the fears expressed in this film but the terror unleashed by the atomic bomb, and the resulting awareness of humanity’s mortality, still manages to disturb and confront. Ultimately “The Incredible Shrinking Man” turns out to be a less propagandic and more humane film than much of Cold War science-fiction.

results.title: The Incredible San Francisco artists' soapbox derby
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films and Amanda C Pope
results.brief_description: In the spring of 1975, 104 artists of San Francisco let fly with imagination and creativity and built 75 “cars” and 32 trophies for an artists’ annual soapbox (billycart) derby. Entries were built from such diverse materials as wire, papier-mache, sage-brush and bread. They raised $20,000 for the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art.

results.title: The Incredible magic of magic
results.brief_description: Master magician, Bob Yorburg, stars and hosts ‘The Incredible magic of magic’, an easy to follow demonstration and instruction on two of the most well known and oldest examples of ‘close-up’ or ‘slight of hand’ magic. Complete with Bob’s magic tips these tricks can be performed using a few things found around the home. Suitable for persons 8 years and over.

results.title: The Incredible journey
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Walt Disney and Fletcher Markle
results.brief_description: A holidaying family leave their three pets: Bodger, a bull-terrior; Tao, a Siamese cat; and Luath, a Labrador retriever in charge of a family guest, Emile. When the guest goes off hunting but fails to inform the animals, the three pets begin an incredible journey, over 200 miles to reach their owners. With the majestic Canadian countryside as a backdrop, this film is based on the book by Sheila Burnford. Starring Emile Genest, John Drainie, Tommy Tweed and Sandra Algar.

results.title: The Incredible human machine
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Irwin Rosten
results.brief_description: A journey through the wondrous inner world of the human body. Explore the fascinating, microscopic universe that exists within us all. How does the eye adjust in light? How do our muscles enable us to move? How does the eardrum process sound? With the help of sophisticated photographic techniques you are now able to discover the wonders of the internal human world.

results.title: The Incredible hulk
results.brief_description: Exposed to a nuclear explosion, Dr Banner is a male scientist who has been infected with powerful gamma rays. When he becomes angry an energy surge transforms him into The Incredible Hulk - a burly green man of limited mental capacity but infinite strength and determination, who fights evil. This tape consists of three episodes, broken down into three segments, from the animated television series, adapted from the Marvel Comic. Set amidst the Cold War period, American army intelligence forces battle the Russians and fight terrorization from outer space creatures. Banner, who works for the mistrusting army, struggles with his alter ego, the monstrous Hulk. In these episodes Banner tries to continue his research but he is continuously fighting off enemy hoards, being captured and, when turning into the Hulk under stress, escaping. Episode one: “A Titan rides the train”. “The Horde of the humanoids”, “On the rampage” Episode two: “The Power of Dr Banner”. “Where strides the behemoth”. “Back from the dead”. Episode three: “Micro-monsters”. “The Lair of the leader”. “To live again”. In episodes two and three, the tape has occasional tracking problems and minor moments of audio dropout.

results.title: The Incredible art of animation
results.brief_description: An introduction to the basic techniques of animation, the film demonstrates the recording of sound, speech, music and the animation of sketches. Designed to stimulate interest in this art at the amateur film making level.

results.title: The Inconstant air
results.creator_credit: National Academy of Sciences (U.S.) and Lothar Wolff
results.brief_description: The exploration of the physical nature of the atmosphere, showing such things as the pattern of the winds which is so important to the weather forecaster.

results.title: The Incomplete
results.creator_credit: State Distribution Centre and Zdenka Doycheva
results.brief_description: A little boy is drawing happily when, suddenly, the telephone rings. While the artist is away a feud develops between the two animated figures. Just as one is about to pronounce himself victorious, the boy returns and quickly provides a happy ending for all. No commentary - music and sound effects only.
